alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lee; Southern Lancaster; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lancaster, Lee, Chesterfield, northwestern Sumter and eastern Kershaw Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Heath Springs to near Goodale State Park to 7 miles north of Oakland. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Camden, Bishopville, Pageland, Kershaw, Chesterfield, Elgin, Heath Springs, Westville, Cassatt, Lee State Park, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Mt Pisgah, Goodale State Park, Mcbee, Jefferson, Ruby, Patrick, Bethune, Mount Croghan and Lucknow. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 98 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central South Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lee; Southern Lancaster; Sumter
